<table bgColor="#ffffff" border="0" width="100%"> <tbody> <tr> <td width="100%" align="center"> <br /> <a href="index.html"><img border="0" alt="Chemical Markup Language (CML)" title="Chemical Markup Language (CML)" hspace="0" src="CmlTitle.png" width="470" height="50" align="middle"/></a> </td> </tr> </tbody> </table> <p> Chemical Markup Language (CML) provides support for most chemistry including molecules, compounds, reactions, spectra, crystals and computational chemistry. </p> <p> These examples show how to visualize <a href="http://xml-cml.org" target="_blank">Chemical Markup Language (CML)</a> molecular definitions using previously designed X3D model prototypes by using an <a href="CmlToX3d.xslt" target="_blank">XSLT stylesheet</a> transformations. This process is described in the paper &quot;<a href="Polys.StylesheetTransformationsInteractiveVisualization.Web3d2003Symposium.pdf" target="_blank">Stylesheet Transformations for Interactive Visualization: Towards a Web3D Chemistry Curricula</a>,&quot; originally published in <i><a href="http://dl.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=636593&picked=prox&CFID=74553243&CFTOKEN=60897567" target="_blank">Proceedings of Web3D 2003 Symposium</a></i>, St. Malo France, 9-12 March 2003, ACM Press. </p>
